imply.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly
imply.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Cleo blushed. She had not meant to imply that he was lying.
imply.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if a fact, event etc implies something, it shows that it is likely to be true
imply.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
imply.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if one thing implies another, it proves that the second thing exists
imply.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Democracy implies a respect for individual liberties.
High profits do not necessarily imply efficiency.
